questions.text: Which of the following organisms is transmitted by the vector shown in the image below?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Kyasanur Forest disease The image given below is of a Tick. From the options given above, KFD is transmitted by hard ticks, the principal vector being Haemaphysalis spinigera.

Highyeild:

Kyasanur Forest disease (KFD): This is a hemorrhagic fever found in Karnataka state (India). Infection is transmitted by the bite of ticks, the principal vector being Haemaphysalis spinigera Hard ticks (Haemaphysalis spinigera) are the reservoir of KFD virus and once infected, remain so for life . Rodents, shrews, and monkeys are common hosts for KFDV after being bitten by an infected tick Clinical features : KFD has an abrupt onset of fever, headache, conjunctivitis, myalgia and severe prostration. Some cases develop hemorrhages in the skin, mucosa and viscera. Diagnosis can be made in the early stage of illness by molecular detection by PCR or virus isolation from blood. There is no specific treatment for KFD, but early hospitalization and supportive therapy is important. Supportive therapy includes the maintenance of hydration and the usual precautions for patients with bleeding disorders

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A. Anaplasma: Anaplasmosis is a disease caused by the bacterium Anaplasma phagocytophilum. These bacteria are spread to people by tick bites primarily from the blacklegged tick Option B. Orientia tsutsugamushi: Spread by trombiculid mite Option D. Tick typhus: Also known as Rocky Mountain spotted fever, an acute febrile (feverish) disease initially recognized in the Rocky Mountain states, caused by Rickettsia rickettsii transmitted by hard-shelled (ixodid) ticks

Solution:

Standard deviation

Highyeild:

Standard Deviation (SD) It is the square root of variance. The standard deviation of a population is denoted by σ and the standard deviation of sample is denoted by just s. The formula for the standard deviation of a sample (usually <30): For a population (large sample), the denominator would be replaced by just N. It is particularly useful for normal distributions but can be used in skewed distributions. High or low standard deviation indicates data points are respectively above or below the mean The empirical rule of a normal distribution states that: One standard deviation of the mean : 68% distribution fall Two standard distributions of the mean : 95% distribution fall Three standard distributions of the mean : 7% distribution fall Graph showing normal distribution curve

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION B: Sample variance : It measures the average squared deviation from the sample mean. OPTION C: Sample mean: It represents the average value set of a data. Option D : Median: The median represents the middle value in a set of data when arranged in ascending or descending order.

Extraedge:

Measure used in statistics and their examples Measure of dispersion or variability or spread - Range, Interquartile range, Variance, Standard deviation . Measure of position - Z score, Percentile, Quartile Measure of central tendency - Mean, Median, Mode

questions.text: A child came for DPT vaccination at 10 weeks. He has a history of fever of more than 40°C and an inconsolable cry at 6 weeks of age following vaccination. What should be done next ?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Give DPT C ommon adverse events for pertussis vaccines are seizures, hypotonic-hyporesponsive episodes, and prolonged crying, hyperpyrexia. These are precautions but not contraindications to giving the next dose of DTwP

Highyeild:

Common side effects of DTwP include: Injection site reactions includes redness, warmth, swelling, tenderness, itching, pain, hives, and rash, Fever Drowsiness Persistent crying Febrile seizures Contraindications of DTwP Severe allergic reactions or anaphylaxis after administration of the DTaP vaccine or vaccine component Encephalopathy (coma, a decreased level of consciousness, or prolonged seizures) that occurs within seven days of DTaP administration Note : Pregnancy should not be considered a contraindication to DTaP vaccination

questions.text: 30,000 women were followed up for 10 years for the development of breast cancer. 1200 women developed cancer and were given a questionnaire to assess possible risk factors. Additionally, 2000 women from the same study were used as controls and were also given the questionnaire. What is this type of study called?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Nested case control A nested case-control study design involves the selection of several healthy controls for each case, typically from those still under observation at the time when the case developed the disease

Highyeild:

A nested case-control study is a case-control study situated within a prospective cohort study . The prospective cohort study generates cases and potential controls for the nested case-control study. Whenever a case occurs, a control can be selected from among the cohort members who do not have the disease at that point in time, providing a firm procedure for control selection. Advantages Efficient - not all members of parent cohort require diagnostic testing Reduces selection bias - cases and controls sampled from same population Reduces information bias - risk factor exposure can be assessed with investigator blind to case status Disadvantages Reduced power of the study as sample size is decreased

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A. In a case-cohort study, cases are defined as those participants of the cohort who developed the disease of interest, but controls are identified before the cases develop. This means that controls are randomly chosen from all cohort participants regardless of whether they have the disease of interest or not , and that baseline data can be collected early in the study Option B. Case-control studies are retrospective. They clearly define two groups at the start: one with the outcome/disease and one without the outcome/disease. They look back to assess whether there is a statistically significant difference in the rates of exposure to a defined risk factor between the groups D Cross sectional is a type of observational study that analyzes data from a population, or a representative subset, at a specific point in time—that is, cross-sectional data.

questions.text: Which OF THE FOLLOWING IS NOT correctly matched?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

DIAGNOSTIC STUDIES- CONSORT

Highyeild:

CONSORT stands for consolidated standards of reporting trials . It is a guideline designed to improve the transparency and reporting of randomized controlled trials . CONSORT provides a checklist and flow diagram to ensure that essential information about the design, conduct, analysis and interpretation of RCT’s is reported in a standardized and comprehensive manner. Different reporting guidelines and their purposes Each of these reporting guidelines aims to improve the quality and transparency of reporting in specific types of medical research. Adhering to these guidelines helps researchers, journal editors, and readers ensure that study findings are accurately presented and can be critically evaluated.

questions.text: Match the diseases with their incubation period? Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A4,B2,C3,D1 CORRECT MATCH IS AS FOLLOWING: Hepatitis-A Chicken Pox SARS Syphilis -50 Days -21 Days -10 Days - 90 Days

Highyeild:

The incubation period of a virus refers to the time between exposure to the virus and the appearance of symptoms or signs of the infection. The length of the incubation period can vary widely depending on the specific virus, individual factors, and the nature of the infection. During this time, viral genomes are replicating and the host is responding, producing cytokines such as interferon that can have global effects, leading to the classical symptoms of an acute infection e.g., fever, malaise, aches, pains, and nausea, also called as prodromal symptoms Virus incubation period Common Cold (Rhinovirus): 1 to 3 days Influenza (Flu) Virus: 1 to 4 days SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19): 2 to 14 days (typically around 5 to 7 days) Measles Virus : 7 to 14 days Chickenpox (Varicella-Zoster Virus): 10 to 21 days Norovirus (Stomach Flu): 12 to 48 hours HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus): Several weeks to months (can be longer) Ebola Virus : 2 to 21 days Rabies Virus : Weeks to months

questions.text: A person had a dog bite. Vaccination is up to date for both the dog and the man. The person's history is significant for having undergone a splenectomy five years ago. What is the best management in this case?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Amoxicillin and potassium clavulanate It is a broad spectrum antibiotic given with vaccination for dog bite cases.

Highyeild:

The post-exposure prophylaxis is a three-pronged approach. All three carry equal importance and should be done simultaneously as per the category of exposure Management of animal bite wound(s) Passive immunization with Rabies Immunoglobulin (RIG) Active immunization with Anti-Rabies Vaccines (ARV) Wound(s) toilet can be done by prompt and gentle thorough washing with soap or detergent and washing the wound(s) with running water. If soap and detergents are not immediately available, wash with running water. The maximum benefit of the wound(s) washing is obtained when fresh wound(s) is cleaned immediately. The application of irritants (like chilies, oil, turmeric, lime, salt, etc) is unnecessary and damaging Application of antiseptics: After thorough washing and drying the wound(s), any one of the available chemical virucidal agents should be applied, such as povidone iodine, alcohol, etc. Local infiltration of rabies immunoglobulin : In category III exposures rabies immunoglobulin should be infiltrated in the depth and around the wound(s) to neutralize the locally present virus Suturing of wound(s) should be avoided as far as possible. If surgically unavoidable, after adequate cleansing, rabies immunoglobulin should be infiltrated in the depth and around the wound(s) and suturing should be delayed by a few hours. The delay in suturing allows diffusion of antibodies in the tissues. Minimum loose sutures should be applied for arresting the bleeding in life threatening situations. Cauterization of wound(s) is no longer recommended as it leaves bad scar, and does not confer any additional advantage over washing the wound(s) with water and soap Tetanus and antibiotic prophylaxis should be given if required . To prevent sepsis in the wound(s), a suitable course of an antibiotic may be recommended. Antibiotic prophylaxis is indicated in High-risk animal bites: Cat bites in any location and hand bites by any animals, including humans. Hand bites have a risk of developing an infection in the closed spaces of the hand High-risk patients: Comorbidities such as diabetes, liver disease, and absence of functional spleen. Patients without a functional spleen are at an increased risk for overwhelming sepsis primarily due to Capnocytophaga species Amoxicillin-clavulanate is the first-line drug of choice for prophylaxis. In patients with penicillin allerg clindamycin plus doxycycline/co-trimoxazole/fluoroquinolone can be used.

questions.text: All of the following statements are true for descriptors of central tendency except?

options.label: A
options.text: Mode is affected by extreme values.

options.label: B
options.text: Mean is affected by extreme value

options.label: C
options.text: Median is calculated by overall observation

options.label: D
options.text: mode can be used as a qualitative data descriptor

questions.correct_answer: A. Mode is affected by extreme values.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mode is affected by extreme values. Mode is not affected by extreme values in a given set of data. The mode is not affected by extreme values, outliers, or values that are significantly different from the rest of the data.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option B. Mean is affected by extreme value is the right statement Option C. Median is calculated by overall observation is the right statement Option D. Mode can be used as a qualitative data descriptor is the right statement
